docs.lead_paragraph: Senate confirmation of Antonio Weiss as an under secretary of the Treasury could be hindered by corporate mergers he was involved in as an executive at Lazard.
docs.snippet: Senate confirmation of Antonio Weiss as an under secretary of the Treasury could be hindered by corporate mergers he was involved in as an executive at Lazard....
docs.abstract: Senate confirmation of Antonio Weiss, Pres Obama's nominee for under secretary of the Treasury, will hinge on battle over his previous role on Wall Street; Weiss oversaw a number of controversial international mega-mergers while head of investment banking at Lazard; nomination has yielded an unexpected proxy war between moderates and liberals in the Democratic Party.

headline.print_headline: Liberal Treasury Nominee’s Wall St. ProwessMay Be a Vulnerability
headline.main: Liberal Treasury Nominee’s Wall St. Prowess May Be a Vulnerability

docs.lead_paragraph: The broader significance of the report is that societies collectively forget according to the same formula as, say, a student who has studied a list of words.
docs.snippet: The broader significance of the report is that societies collectively forget according to the same formula as, say, a student who has studied a list of words....
docs.abstract: Research published in journal Science finds societies collectively forget memories according to same formula as individuals do; report is first to measure forgetfulness over 40-year period, testing Americans' ability to remember names of past presidents; study shows that culture imitates biology, even though two systems work in vastly different ways.

headline.print_headline: Study on Cultural Memory Confirms: Chester A. Arthur, We Hardly Knew Ye
headline.main: Study on Cultural Memory Confirms: Chester A. Arthur, We Hardly Knew Ye

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, the oldest member of the nine-justice court, was released from a Washington hospital on Thursday after undergoing a heart procedure, a court statement said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Billionaire hedge fund manager Chris Hohn has been ordered to pay his estranged wife Jamie Cooper-Hohn 337 million pounds ($530 million) in the largest divorce settlement in British legal history.

headline.print_headline: Hedge Fund Couple Agree Britain's Most Expensive Divorce
headline.main: Hedge Fund Couple Agree Britain's Most Expensive Divorce

docs.lead_paragraph: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was released from the hospital Thursday after having a heart stent implanted to clear a blocked artery, a Supreme Court spokeswoman said.

headline.print_headline: Justice Sent Home After Heart Stent Implanted

docs.lead_paragraph: Santiago Taveras, once the public face for many school closings during the Bloomberg years, is now working on turning around the troubled DeWitt Clinton High School in the Bronx.
docs.snippet: Santiago Taveras, once the public face for many school closings during the Bloomberg years, is now working on turning around the troubled DeWitt Clinton High School in the Bronx....
docs.abstract: Principal Santiago Taveras, former deputy chancellor who was the public face for many school closings during Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's reign, is now fighting to keep DeWitt Clinton High School in the Bronx open; school is battling low graduation rates, plummeting enrollment and unsafe environment.

headline.print_headline: One High Five at a Time
headline.main: After Closing Schools, a Principal Fights to Save a Bronx High School
